alert.note: Alert for Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 11:22AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hot Springs and east central Fremont Counties through 1145 AM MDT... At 1120 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 10 miles southeast of Hamilton Dome, or 13 miles west of Thermopolis, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Hot Springs and east central Fremont Counties, including the following locations... Hot Springs County Airport. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Riverton.

area.areaDesc: Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin
